p: After an incubation period, SARS-CoV-2 invades the mucosal membranes, especially nasal and oral-pharyngeal membranes, causing upper respiratory infection with mild symptoms in the first phase. The virus binds to target cells through angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2). This activates the serine protease TMPRSS2 for S protein priming ( Fig. 2 ) [ 29]. ACE2 is expressed by epithelial cells of the intestine, lung, kidney, and blood vessels [ 30]. Treatment in this phase is based essentially on symptomatic relief, supportive and non-specific therapies, such as acetaminophen. The use of virus-targeting treatments may be beneficial in this period in order to stop viral replication [ 8].
